## Perfect for 2 categorial + 1 numerical variables

::: {.panel-tabset}

## R

```{r, message=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
#library(ggplot2)
babynames %>% 
  filter(
    year %in% 2014:2017,
    n > 1000
    ) %>%
  group_by(name, sex) %>% 
  summarize(mean = mean(n)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  group_by(name) %>% 
  mutate(
    proz = mean/sum(mean)*100,
    diff = abs(proz-50)
  ) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%
  arrange(diff) %>% 
  slice_head(n=8) %>% 
  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = name,
      y = sex,
      fill = proz
    )
  ) +
  geom_tile() +
  labs(
    title = "Babynames for both boyz and girls",
    subtitle = "Powered by the babynames package",
    x = "Name",
    y = "Gender",
    fill = "%"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

  
```
